questions.question_text: Which statement correctly describes the differences between a Client Script and a Business Rule?

choices.A: A Client Script executes before a record is loaded and a Business Rule executes after a record is loaded
choices.D: A Client Script executes before a record is loaded and a Business Rule executes after a record is updated
choices.B: A Client Script executes on the server and a Business Rule executes on the client
choices.C: A Client Script executes on the client and a Business Rule executes on the server

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. A Client Script executes on the client and a Business Rule executes on the server
C is correct. Pages 437 & 438 of the ServiceNow Administration Fundamentals - Tokyo Edition.
C. A Client Script executes on the client and a Business Rule executes on the server - is correct

choices.D: Groups can assign tasks to users based on skills
choices.E: Group members can avoid tasks, which are nearing SLA breach
choices.F: Groups can assign tasks to users based on availability
choices.A: Group members can choose their tasks from My Groups Work
choices.B: Groups can assign tasks to users based on on-call schedules
choices.C: Site support members can pick tasks, based on Location

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABDF
C is a limited scope, just for site support, the question is wider, about all groups. 
E is a non-answer, in best practice that should not happen.
Ans: ABDF

Selected Answer: ABDF
ABDF is correct!

Selected Answer: ABDF
C and E are also true but aren't realistic. The commonsense answers would be ABDF.
Any thoughts about E?
isn't ABCF
PappyFox says it's ABDF!

Selected Answer: ABDF
answer is ABDF
Correct answer is ABDF

questions.question_text: What attributes can you manage, using System Properties > Basic Configuration UI16? (Choose five.)
Which of the following is used to initiate a flow?

discussion.content:
A. The trigger specifies the conditions that start running the flow. When the trigger conditions are met, the system starts running the flow. 
 
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/sandiego-application-development/page/administer/flow-designer/reference/flow-triggers.html

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
A is the answer. A trigger is used to initiate a flow.
A is correct

A is correct
